habitat_description:
The range for the diamond- back watersnake extends from Kansas, southeastern Iowa, Illinois, and southwestern Indiana south to Alabama (east to the Mobile Bay drainage below the Fall Line), Gulf Coast, southcentral Texas, and eastern Mexico to the southwestern base of the Yucatan Peninsula (Tabasco, northern Chiapas, and southwestern Campeche) (Conant and Collins 1991; Gibbons and Dorcas 2004; McAllister 1985). 

In general, the habitat includes the margins and shallows of lakes, ponds, rivers, smaller streams, swamps, marshes, canals, and ditches. It basks on banks and in edge vegetation and may wander on land, especially in wet weather (Gibbons and Dorcas 2004). This semiaquatic snake hibernates in underground burrows near water (Gibbons and Dorcas 2004).
